review: This product was received on time and worked as described. It's great to see new Chromecast support being offered constantly.I can't wait to see all the future applications of this device.Pros:-It's cheap-Let's you share your desktop screen, Chrome tabs, videos, music via the various apps available-I was able to download the Chromecast app on my mobile in Singapore which is great! Thanks for unblocking that Google (I think they did that originally to maintain that customer experience while apps, etc. were being built).-I love the apps connection with Plex, Youtube and the other new apps from big brands joining the mix.Cons:-A few seconds of delay sometimes after clicking to load apps and play videos/ movies on Viki/ Youtube. This may be due to my wifi connection but worth noting.-Does not fully support local Singapore TV stations yet (e.g. Toggle, ChannelNewsAsia, etc.)
author: runhappy

review: Ours stopped working well 1 month after purchase.  After screwing around for days off and on, I still don't know if the problem is the within the Chromecast device or our Xfinity Comcast Gateway and service.  Comcast and Chromecast both have lousy Customer Service and documentation, so we can't figure out why various gizmos don't work and play well together.  Chromecast might be taking the reputation hit for problems created by Comcast controlled (gateway) device settings in our area. Comcast's business practices tell us on a regular basis that they don't care. You've been warned especially if you are forced to play in the Comcast sandbox.
author: W. Hawkins

author: kmaster54321

review: Not much to say about the Chromecast other than it is awesome. I love this thing. With limited space during my deployment to Africa, I bought this thing mainly to stream movies from Netflix, video/audio from Youtube and listen to Pandora from my smartphone. It does just that and more. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to do any of the aforementioned activities for a really cheap price using something that takes up very little room.
author: W. S. Garvey

review: First off this device could be great! but like most Google products...they phoned it in. There are too few apps available...if you want to watch anything other than Netflix, Hulu or Google Play search for a different device....it has no Amazon video or Vudu. The option to cast from your browser leads to poor quality playback and choppy video. Disappointed that even when using Chrome I can not stream from the browser on my Google Tab. The one great thing about the Chrome Cast is that it allows me to us my tablet as a Netflix remote. However, in my house it is simply a $35 Netflix streaming device. In the future I will replace it with a Sony product and it will get cast to the dungeon t.v. to rarely be used again.Correction - increased by one star because Vudu can be cast to the chromecast, but Google does not advertise it and doesn't display Vudu when you search for Chromecast apps. Would give it a five if it could stream from Amazon Video and other video apps like A&E.;
